title: The biter bitten, or, The broker well-fitted by the joyner, and the joyners wife. This crafty knave, thought to inslave, in sending for his wife; the gold they keep, and he may weep, to mend his wicked life. To the tune of, The two English travellers. This may be printed, R.P.
publicationStmtPublisher: Printed for I. Blare on London [...],
